class.name: RenderingEffect
class.brief_description: This resource allows for creating a custom rendering effect.
class.description: This resource defines a custom rendering effect that can be applied to [Viewport]s through the viewports [Environment]. You can implement a callback that is called during rendering at a given stage of the rendering pipeline and allows you to insert additional passes. Note that this callback happens on the rendering thread.

method.name: _render_callback
method.description: Implement this function with your custom rendering code. [param effect_callback_type] should always match the effect callback type you've specified in [member effect_callback_type]. [param render_data] provides access to the rendering state, it is only valid during rendering and should not be stored.

members.member: The type of effect that is implemented, determines at what stage of rendering the callback is called.

constants.constant: The callback is called before our opaque rendering pass, but after depth prepass (if applicable).
The callback is called after our opaque rendering pass, but before our sky is rendered.
The callback is called before our transparent rendering pass, but after our sky is rendered and we've created our back buffers.
The callback is called after our transparent rendering pass, but before any build in post effects and output to our render target.
The callback is called to perform our upscaling rendering pass. Only one such effect is applied.
Represents the size of the [enum EffectCallbackType] enum.
